FT::StoreCheckpointService

To load checkpoint files that correspond to threads, the FT::LoadCheckpointService::service object should be used. More...

Detailed Description

Checkpoint service to store file

On each process of a Kaapi application, a checkpoint service accepts request from remote node in order to store checkpoint data. Each process has its checkpoint server where it will store its checkpoint data. The default service is FT::StoreCheckpointService::service. The class definition expose both client and server interface.The server side store directly the incomming message that correspond to the serialization of a thread (thus, if the library is compiled with heterogeneous support, the message could be reload from any process). To load checkpoint files that correspond to threads, the FT::LoadCheckpointService::service object should be used.

void FT::StoreCheckpointService::commit (  ) 

Commit of the object: can use network

void FT::StoreCheckpointService::commit_update ( Net::GlobalId  gid_ack = Net::GlobalId::NO_SITE,
Net::Service::Id  sid_ack = 0 
)

End the transaction with the checkpoint server The server will update the sended checkpoint metaDataInfos retaled to 'this' process. If the thread related to this metaDataInfo exists before, then we will replace its previous one by this new metaDataInfo; else, we will add this metaDataInfo. Old ChkMetaDataInfo in the checkpoint server will be cleaned depending of its capacity (property chkserver.capacity) Then the checkpoint server will acknowledge the receipt of the checkpoints to the service sid_ack at process gid_ack if they are specified

Parameters:
[in] GlobalId of the process to acknowledge to
[in] Id of the service to acknowledge to

void FT::StoreCheckpointService::store ( ChkId  chkid,
Util::Format::Id  fid,
const void *  object 
)

Store the object under the identifier chkid to the correct checkpoint server depending on the local_gid. The method is non blocking and the user should call sync to ensure that all previous stores have correctly send data to the server

Parameters:
[in] identifier of the checkpoint
[in] object format identifier, used to serialize it to the checkpoint server
[in] pointerto the object
Util::ComFailure::Code FT::StoreCheckpointService::sync (  ) 

Wait until all local messages have been sent to the server

Returns:
and error code if != Util::ComFailure::OK
